item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Rescue Crews Search for Survivors After Kenya Building Collapse
item.description:
Rescue Crews Search for Survivors After Kenya Building Collapse

Rescue crews in the Kenyan capital, Nairobi, are searching for survivors after flooding caused a seven-story residential building to collapse, trapping an unknown number of people inside. Arnolda Shiundu, a spokeswoman for the Kenya Red Cross, said authorities don't know how many people are trapped in the rubble, but added "we fear there are still several of them."

item.title: Alcohol Fuels High Death Toll on South African Roads
item.description:
Alcohol Fuels High Death Toll on South African Roads

It's a scene repeated in bars across South Africa every day and night: A man saunters into the establishment, tosses his car keys on the counter and starts drinking an alcoholic beverage. He's parked his car in a space nearby, and will be driving it within a few hours.

item.title: Moscow Cools Anti-Western Rhetoric at Security Conference
item.description:
Moscow Cools Anti-Western Rhetoric at Security Conference

Tensions between Russia and the United States have escalated over the conflicts in Syria and Ukraine, but there were signs at an international security conference in Moscow this month that the Kremlin may be softening its tone toward the West.

item.title: Sadr Supporters Storm Iraqi Parliament
item.description:
Sadr Supporters Storm Iraqi Parliament

Supporters of Iraq's mercurial Shi'ite cleric Muqtada al-Sadr have stormed the Iraqi parliament, after entering Baghdad's government-controlled "Green Zone." A Saturday session of parliament to approve members of a new government had been called off for lack of a quorum earlier in the day.

item.title: Russian Censorship Group Seeks Chinese Help to Better Control Internet
item.description:
Russian Censorship Group Seeks Chinese Help to Better Control Internet

Russian authorities are seeking greater control of information on the internet, with some who favor tighter restrictions looking to China. Russia's Safe Internet League, an influential lobby, hosted a first-ever forum Wednesday in Moscow with China's top internet censors, including Fang Binxing, known as the "Father of the Great Firewall of China."
